column4: does anyone know how i can install ubuntu to a new hard drive from within window or ubuntu?
I have a windows/ubuntu box, i have a new HD. I would like to install ubuntu on that new HD.
Just put the install CD, and in the step where it asks about partitions, there should be an option, I think
Ohh, you installed Ubuntu through Wubi?
well, I think you should burn that image
ohh :P Well, there is a way to move your wubi virtual partition to a real one… let me search it for you
I think wubi is for installing ubuntu inside windows as a virtual file, so it's normal that it doesn't have an option for a full install outside windows
and yes, LVPM should probably do the job of moving your Wubi install to the other disk
seems like my cunning plan of using vmwareplayer wil work :)
but that won't be a full install! :P         well, good luck with that ;)
err… I meant… it won't be running natively, I thought that's what you wanted, full speed :)
I will then take the HD and stick it in my other computer
